channel.title: Hey question.. lol
channel.description: is there a code to give me the quests for free? or do we have to do them all

item.title: Hey question.. lol
item.dc:creator: @Unholy_Angel Unholy Angel
item.description:
@Unholy_Angel wrote:

just go ::pickup (item id) (item ammount)

Example: ::pickup 0995 1000000000

Which is 1000m. - But you can do the same to any item.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey question.. lol
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Ace1992:

im confused o_o ok lets say i have a rune and its id is 555, then i do ::setitem 555 1050 and lets say 1050 is a rune scimmy, then i can’t equip rune scimmy… why? how do i do this i need help =\

Because the ::setitem is clientside. In other words, it is in the program your using. It is not in the server. The server has to send certain packets to the client in order for the client to update the image and render you as wielding the thing. So the server isn’t registered that you changed that item, and it doesn’t send the packet.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey question.. lol
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Well, changing those would require knowlege of the exact specifics of how the client works (Since those are client side things) and nobody except Jagex has that knowlege for now. Also, it’s a double edged sword:

You can do anything that has been programmed into the server.
You can’t do anything that hasn’t.

Read full topic
